abstract.text: Creates a list that identifies its rows based on a key path to the
identifier of the underlying data and allowing users to have
exactly one row always selected.

abstract.text: Declare the user interface and behavior for your app on every platform.
A property wrapper type that can read and write a value owned by a source of
truth.
A structure that computes views on demand from an underlying collection of
identified data.
A container that presents rows of data arranged in a single column,
optionally providing the ability to select one or more members.
Creates a list that identifies its rows based on a key path to the
identifier of the underlying data, optionally allowing users to select a
single row.
Creates a list that identifies its rows based on a key path to the
identifier of the underlying data, optionally allowing users to select
multiple rows.
Creates a list that identifies its rows based on a key path to the
identifier of the underlying data, optionally allowing users to select a
single row.
Creates a list that identifies its rows based on a key path to the
identifier of the underlying data and allowing users to have
exactly one row always selected.
Creates a list that identifies its rows based on a key path to the
identifier of the underlying data, optionally allowing users to select
multiple rows.
A type that represents part of your app’s user interface and provides
modifiers that you use to configure views.
A custom parameter attribute that constructs views from closures.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A collection that supports subscript assignment.
A type representing the sequence’s elements.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
An unordered collection of unique elements.
A collection that supports efficient random-access index traversal.
A type that represents a position in the collection.
A type that represents the indices that are valid for subscripting the collection, in ascending order.

A `Sequence` whose elements consist of those in a `Base` `Sequence` passed through a transform function returning `Element`. These elements are computed lazily, each time they’re read, by calling the transform function on a base element.
A key path from a specific root type to a specific resulting value type.
